translated: “Prince, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have great compassion and who are steadfast through skillful means teach this king of samādhis, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, they should be seated on a seat of grass in a solitary place.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rnams la mchod pa rgya cher bya ba la brtson par gyur cing /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rnams la mchod pa rgya cher bya ba la brtson par gyur cing /
translated: They will be diligent in making vast offerings to the stūpas of the tathāgatas who have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher rab tu ston pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher rab tu ston pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they teach this king of samādhis, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, to others,

original: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: “Young man, at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattvas will be established in the gate of liberation that is emptiness, the gate of liberation that is signlessness, and the gate of liberation that is aspirationlessness.

original: de chos gang la'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de chos gang la'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: They will not apprehend any phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa ni smon lam thams cad la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa ni smon lam thams cad la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Young man, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in the practice of the samādhi of the absence of apprehension are established in all aspirations.

original: @184a *// gzhon nu /
analyzed: @184a *// gzhon nu /
translated: “Young man,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po smon lam thams cad la gnas pa ni bdag dang sems can kun gyi smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po smon lam thams cad la gnas pa ni bdag dang sems can kun gyi smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is established in all aspirations will fulfill all his own and others’ aspirations.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'ang myur du thob cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'ang myur du thob cing /
translated: He will also quickly attain this samādhi,

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang bya'o //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang bya'o //
translated: and he will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.”

original: gzhon nu / rnam grangs 'dis kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / rnam grangs 'dis kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: “Young man, you should understand it in this way:

original: gzhon nu / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa grangs med pa bas ches grangs med pa /🔽yangs pa / tshad med pa /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa /🔽dpag tu med par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa grangs med pa bas ches grangs med pa / yangs pa / tshad med pa / bsam gyis mi khyab pa / dpag tu med par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Young man, in the past, infinite, innumerable, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and inexpressible numbers of eons ago,🔽at that time, in this world realm of Saha,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha, the one with perfect wisdom and conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassable guide who tames beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the buddha, the bhagavān named Śākyamuni appeared in the world.🔽“Young man, at that time, in that time, in this Sahā world realm, the lifespan of the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni was eighty years.🔽“Young man, at that time, in that time, in this Sahā world realm, the human lifespan was short, it was ten years.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: He is the unsurpassed guide who tames beings.🔽

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: He was a teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dbyangs byin zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dbyangs byin zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: a buddha, a bhagavat.

original: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dbyangs byin nges sems can grangs med dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dbyangs byin nges sems can grangs med dpag tu med pa /
translated: “Prince, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Ghoṣadatta established countless, innumerable beings🔽in the state of arhatship with the outflows exhausted.

original: zag pa zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod de; rab tu bkod cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang sems can grangs med dpag tu med pa bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par yang rab @184b tu
analyzed: zag pa zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod de; rab tu bkod cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang sems can grangs med dpag tu med pa bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par yang rab @184b tu
translated: After he had established them and passed into parinirvana, he established countless, innumerable beings in irreversible progress toward the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: bkod nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
analyzed: bkod nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
translated: After he had established them and passed into parinirvana,

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling na rgyal po dpal dbyangs zhes bya bas /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling na rgyal po dpal dbyangs zhes bya bas /
translated: “Prince, at that time, in that time, in Jambudvipa there was a king named Shrighosa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong byas te /
translated: He built 84,000,000,000 stūpas containing the relics of the Tathāgata, in order to make offerings to the Tathāgata who had passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: mchod rten re re la'ang mar me'i yon bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong btsugs so //🔽de bzhin du mchod rten re re la'ang rol mo dang / sil snyan dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang; byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: mchod rten re re la'ang mar me'i yon bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong btsugs so // de bzhin du mchod rten re re la'ang rol mo dang / sil snyan dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang; byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: He lit 84,000,000,000 lamps at each stūpa.

original: ba dan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong phul lo //
analyzed: ba dan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong phul lo //
translated: In the same way, he offered 84,000,000,000 musical instruments, cymbals, flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners,🔽and flags at each stūpa.

original: gzhon nu / 'di ltar rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can la mchod pa byas nas byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu'i byang chub sems dpa' mang po bsogs nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
analyzed: gzhon nu / 'di ltar rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can la mchod pa byas nas byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu'i byang chub sems dpa' mang po bsogs nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
translated: “Young man, in this way King Śrīghoṣa, having made offerings to the stūpa that contained the relics of the Tathāgata, gathered together a great many bodhisattvas, eight hundred thousand quintillion bodhisattvas.

original: chen po de dag thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis mchod pa la brtson par gyur to //
analyzed: chen po de dag thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis mchod pa la brtson par gyur to //
translated: He made offerings to all those bodhisattva mahāsattvas with every kind of offering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad kyang chos smra ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad kyang chos smra ba yin te /
translated: All those bodhisattva mahāsattvas were dharmabhāṇakas

original: spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa /
analyzed: spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa /
translated: who were unceasing in their eloquence,

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa /
translated: who had attained samādhi,

original: chags pa med pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pa /🔽yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi chos @185a *//
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pa / yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi chos @185a *//
translated: who had attained unimpeded retention,🔽who taught the Dharma of the true qualities,

original: ston pa / yongs su dag pa'i chos ston pa /
analyzed: ston pa / yongs su dag pa'i chos ston pa /
translated: who taught the pure Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sha stag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sha stag go /
translated: and who were bodhisattvas who had attained the highest perfection.

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor de'i nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor de'i nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: “Young man, at that time there was in that assembly a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Kṣemadatta.

original: byis pa gzhon nu skra nag pa /🔽dang po'i lang tsho dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byis pa gzhon nu skra nag pa / dang po'i lang tsho dang ldan pa /
translated: He was a young boy, with black hair,🔽in his prime,

original: na tshod dar la bab pa /
analyzed: na tshod dar la bab pa /
translated: in the first stage of life,

original: 'dod pa la rnam par ma rtses shing /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par ma rtses shing /
translated: who had not enjoyed desires,

original: gzhon nur tshangs par spyad pa /
analyzed: gzhon nur tshangs par spyad pa /
translated: who was a youth leading the pure life,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo gcig lon pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo gcig lon pa zhig yod do //
translated: who had been a bhikṣu for one year.

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de dag la gsol pa btab pa /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de dag la gsol pa btab pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Young man, at that time King Śrīghoṣa made a request to that great assembly of bodhisattvas:🔽‘I wish to hear the samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yang dag par sdud pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yang dag par sdud pa /
translated: It is the gathering of the six perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gzungs chen po dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / dbang dang 'dul ba chags pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la gsol ba btab nas; de'i nub mo mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rnams kyi mdun du mar me'i yon bye
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gzungs chen po dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / dbang dang 'dul ba chags pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la gsol ba btab nas; de'i nub mo mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rnams kyi mdun du mar me'i yon bye
translated: He made requests to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas in order to accomplish the retention of the bodhisattva canon, skill in means, and the unattached training and discipline.

original: ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag rab tu 'bar bar byas te /
analyzed: ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag rab tu 'bar bar byas te /
translated: That night he lit a quintillion lamps in front of the stūpas that contained the relics of the tathāgatas.

original: khyams kyi dkyil 'khor yang phyag dar byas shing chag chag btab nas rab tu byug pa byas /
analyzed: khyams kyi dkyil 'khor yang phyag dar byas shing chag chag btab nas rab tu byug pa byas /
translated: He swept the courtyard, sprinkled it with perfumed water, and anointed it.

original: me tog mngon par bkram zhing /
analyzed: me tog mngon par bkram zhing /
translated: He scattered flowers

original: mal stan sna tshogs bting ste /
analyzed: mal stan sna tshogs bting ste /
translated: and laid out various bedding.

original: rgyal po dpal dbyangs de btsun @185b mo'i  'khor dang bcas /🔽grong dang yul mi 'khor dang bcas /
analyzed: rgyal po dpal dbyangs de btsun @185b mo'i  'khor dang bcas / grong dang yul mi 'khor dang bcas /
translated: King Śrīghoṣa, together with his harem,🔽his retinue of citizens and countrymen,

original: grong mir bcas pa khyim gyi nang nas byung ste /
analyzed: grong mir bcas pa khyim gyi nang nas byung ste /
translated: and his retinue of townspeople, left his house.

original: rol mo dang / sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams thogs nas mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rnams la mchod pa byas nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas te khang thog tu dong ngo //
analyzed: rol mo dang / sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams thogs nas mchod rten de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rnams la mchod pa byas nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas te khang thog tu dong ngo //
translated: They made offerings to the stūpas that contained the relics of the Tathāgata, and then, together with their retinues of queens, went up to the roof of the palace to listen to the Dharma.

original: lha dang mi'i 'khor kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir mang du tshogs te byang chub sems dpa' bde bas byin gyis de dag mthong ba dang / mar me'i yon du phul ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag rab tu 'bar bar byas pas de'i 'od kyis gcig tu khyab ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i 'khor kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir mang du tshogs te byang chub sems dpa' bde bas byin gyis de dag mthong ba dang / mar me'i yon du phul ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag rab tu 'bar bar byas pas de'i 'od kyis gcig tu khyab ste /
translated: The retinues of gods and humans also gathered in great numbers to listen to the Dharma. The bodhisattva Kṣemadatta saw them and offered many quintillions of lamps, which illuminated everything around him.

original: lha dang mi'i skye bo mang po rnams chos nyan par tshogs par rig nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye bo mang po rnams chos nyan par tshogs par rig nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Knowing that many gods and humans had gathered to listen to the Dharma, he thought this:

original: bdag ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa yin na /
translated: “I have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: da bdag ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa zhig bya ste /
analyzed: da bdag ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa zhig bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to attain this samādhi, I will make an offering to the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa ji lta bus lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba dang / yi rangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid bde ba skyes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa ji lta bus lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba dang / yi rangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid bde ba skyes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By what kind of offering to the Tathāgata will the world with its gods, humans, and asuras be astonished, and will they be delighted, joyful, happy, and content?

original: chos kyi snang ba thob pa dang / rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa thams cad dang ldan pa @186a *//🔽'di'ang zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba thob pa dang / rgyal po dpal dbyangs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa thams cad dang ldan pa @186a *//🔽'di'ang zil gyis mnan te /
translated: By what kind of offering will they obtain the light of the Dharma and surpass the offering made to the Tathāgata by King Śrīghoṣa?

original: rgyal po dpal dbyangs btsun mo'i 'khor dang zhabs 'bring bar bcas pa'ang ngo mtshar du gyur cing yi rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur bar mchod par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: rgyal po dpal dbyangs btsun mo'i 'khor dang zhabs 'bring bar bcas pa'ang ngo mtshar du gyur cing yi rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur bar mchod par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: The king, the queen, and the retinue will be amazed and will rejoice, be delighted, pleased, and happy.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin de ltar sems dga' zhing yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin de ltar sems dga' zhing yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta, having given rise to such joy and happiness,

original: chos nyan pa'i skye bo'i tshogs chen po 'dus par rig nas de'i nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi mdun du 'dug nas lag pa g-yas pa ras kyis dkris te 'bru mar gyi nang du bcug go /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i skye bo'i tshogs chen po 'dus par rig nas de'i nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi mdun du 'dug nas lag pa g-yas pa ras kyis dkris te 'bru mar gyi nang du bcug go /
translated: knowing that a great assembly of people had gathered to listen to the Dharma, sat in front of the stūpa of the Tathāgata that night, wrapped his right arm in cloth, and placed it in a container of oil.

original: 'bru mar gyi nang du bcug nas 'bar bar byas so //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi nang du bcug nas 'bar bar byas so //
translated: Having placed it in the container of oil, he set it on fire.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin lhag pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin lhag pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta, who was engaged in superior intention,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs shing /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs shing /
translated: With a superior intention, he had set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub yongs su 'tshol ba'i lag pa g-yas pa da ltar 'bar yang sems dang bzhin gyi mdog 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub yongs su 'tshol ba'i lag pa g-yas pa da ltar 'bar yang sems dang bzhin gyi mdog 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Even though his right hand was burning as he sought awakening, his mind and the color of his face did not change.

original: gzhon nu / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin gyi lag pa g-yas pa bsregs nas rab tu 'bar zhing mer gyur te /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bde bas byin gyi lag pa g-yas pa bsregs nas rab tu 'bar zhing mer gyur te /
translated: “Then, young man, as the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta burned his right hand, it became a mass of flames.

original: me lce gcig tu 'bar bar gyur ma thag tu de'i tshe sa chen po 'di'ang rab tu g-yos par gyur to //

translated: The sublime Dharma of that Blessed One remained for a hundred thousand quintillion years.

original: ba can mang po byung ste /
analyzed: ba can mang po byung ste /
translated: “Prince, when the teachings of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Aṣṭamahābhaumāgrya­praṇidhāna­viśiṣṭa­rāja were in decline, during the final five hundred years, there were many monks who had the view of reference points.

original: de dag 'di lta bu'i mdo sde la mi sred mi mos shing phyir zlog par byed /
analyzed: de dag 'di lta bu'i mdo sde la mi sred mi mos shing phyir zlog par byed /
translated: They did not appreciate or believe in such sūtras as this one, and they opposed it.

original: spong bar byed de /
analyzed: spong bar byed de /
translated: They rejected it.

original: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong dag la'ang gnod par byed cing srog kyang gcod par byed de /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong dag la'ang gnod par byed cing srog kyang gcod par byed de /
translated: They will harm and kill the monks who uphold this sūtra.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa de dag gis mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong stong srog bcad par gyur to //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa de dag gis mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'i dge slong stong srog bcad par gyur to //
translated: Because of their attachment to material gain and honor, they will kill a thousand monks who uphold this sūtra.

original: gzhon nu / de'i che de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs zhes bya ba dzambu'i gling la dbang ba /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i che de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs zhes bya ba dzambu'i gling la dbang ba /
translated: “Young man, at that time there will be a king named Jñānabala who will rule Jambudvīpa.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin la /
translated: He will uphold the true Dharma

original: sngon gyi smon lam phun sum tshogs pa zhig byung ste /🔽gzhon nu / yang de'i @192a *//
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam phun sum tshogs pa zhig byung ste / gzhon nu / yang de'i @192a *//
translated: and will have perfectly fulfilled his previous aspirations.

original: tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling 'dir dge slong yang dag blo gros zhes bya ba ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dzin pa /
analyzed: tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling 'dir dge slong yang dag blo gros zhes bya ba ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dzin pa /
translated: “Young man, at that time, in this Jambudvīpa there will be a monk called Samyaksamudra­dhara who will uphold this samādhi.

original: chos smra ba rgyal po de'i pho brang du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: chos smra ba rgyal po de'i pho brang du 'gro zhing /
translated: He will be a dharmabhāṇaka who goes to the king’s palace

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa /🔽phan par 'dod pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa / phan par 'dod pa /
translated: and acts as his spiritual friend.🔽He will be one who wishes to benefit others,

original: snying brtse ba don du 'dod pa zhig byung ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba don du 'dod pa zhig byung ste /
translated: one who wishes to benefit them through compassion.

original: rgyal po de'ang de la rgyun mi chad par blta bas mi ngoms te rtag tu 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po de'ang de la rgyun mi chad par blta bas mi ngoms te rtag tu 'dod par gyur to //
translated: The king, too, was never satisfied with looking at him, and always wanted to see him.

original: de'ang bstan pa dang / chos kyi gtam bya ba dang / nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / bzung ba dang tshig gis go bar byed nus shing dge slong chos smra ba de /
analyzed: de'ang bstan pa dang / chos kyi gtam bya ba dang / nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / bzung ba dang tshig gis go bar byed nus shing dge slong chos smra ba de /
translated: He was able to teach, to speak about the Dharma, to approach, to serve, to question, to hold, and to understand the words.

original: sems can dag gi g-yo ba dang / spyod lam dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / bag chags la mkhas te /
analyzed: sems can dag gi g-yo ba dang / spyod lam dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / bag chags la mkhas te /
translated: He was skilled in the movements, conduct, aspirations, elements, and habitual tendencies of beings.

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes shing /
translated: He knew the stages of faculties, powers, and perseverance of beings.

original: khams dang bag chags la'ang mkhas /
analyzed: khams dang bag chags la'ang mkhas /
translated: He was skilled in the elements and habitual tendencies.

original: bden pa dang mtshams sbyar ba la'ang mkhas /
analyzed: bden pa dang mtshams sbyar ba la'ang mkhas /
translated: He was skilled in connecting with the truths.

original: mtshams dbral ba dang tshig gi lan gtan la dbab pa la'ang mkhas /
analyzed: mtshams dbral ba dang tshig gi lan gtan la dbab pa la'ang mkhas /
translated: He was skilled in separating the connections and in establishing answers to objections.

original: spobs pa zab cing sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i cho ga la'ang mkhas /
analyzed: spobs pa zab cing sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i cho ga la'ang mkhas /
translated: He had profound eloquence and was skilled in the rites for taming all beings.

original: gsong por smra zhing bzhin la khro gnyer med pa /
analyzed: gsong por smra zhing bzhin la khro gnyer med pa /
translated: He spoke pleasantly and had no frowns on his face.

original: sems chen por gyur pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: sems chen por gyur pa la gnas pa /
translated: He was established in a great mind.

original: snying rje chen po la brtson pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la brtson pa /
translated: He was diligent in great compassion.

original: pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis ma non pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis ma non pa yin no //
translated: He was not overcome by any opponent.

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs kyi bu mo skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs kyi bu mo skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa /
translated: “Prince, at that time, King Jñānabala had a daughter named Jñānāvatī, who was sixteen years old.

original: @192b byad bzhin bzang zhing mdzes la blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: @192b byad bzhin bzang zhing mdzes la blta na sdug pa /
translated: She was beautiful, attractive, and lovely to behold.

original: kha dog bzang zhing rgyas pa'i mchog dang ldan pa ye shes ldan zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
analyzed: kha dog bzang zhing rgyas pa'i mchog dang ldan pa ye shes ldan zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
translated: She had the most excellent, beautiful, and youthful complexion.

original: de'i slob dpon ni dge slong yang dag blo gros zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i slob dpon ni dge slong yang dag blo gros zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Her teacher was a bhikṣu named Samyagmatī,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par ston pa /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par ston pa / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa /
translated: who taught her virtuous qualities,🔽exhorted her,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa /
translated: and delighted her.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: He caused her to take them up.

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong chos smra ba de'i brla gnyis la 'brum bu me dbal nag po chen po gso dka' zhing sman dkon pa zhig byung ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong chos smra ba de'i brla gnyis la 'brum bu me dbal nag po chen po gso dka' zhing sman dkon pa zhig byung ste /
translated: “Young man, at that time the bhikṣu Dharma preacher had on his thighs two large black boils that were difficult to cure and for which medicine was hard to find.

original: na ba de sman pa dag gis spangs par gyur to //
analyzed: na ba de sman pa dag gis spangs par gyur to //
translated: The physician gave up on him.

original: de nas rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa /
translated: “Then King Jñānabala, together with his harem,

analyzed: sras dang / sras mo dang / zhabs 'bring bar bcas pa dge slong de na bar rig nas rab tu du zhing mchi ma byung ngo //
translated: his sons, daughters, and attendants, having heard that the bhikṣu was sick, wept and shed tears.

original: bud med brgyad khrir bcas pa dang / grong dang grong khyer gyi mi rnams su bcas pa dang / yul 'khor ba dang / grong 'dab pa dang / yul gyi mi dang / rtsis pa dang / blon po dang / blon po chen po dang /
analyzed: bud med brgyad khrir bcas pa dang / grong dang grong khyer gyi mi rnams su bcas pa dang / yul 'khor ba dang / grong 'dab pa dang / yul gyi mi dang / rtsis pa dang / blon po dang / blon po chen po dang /
translated: Together with the eighty thousand women, the people of the towns and cities, the people of the provinces, the people of the countryside, the people of the land, the accountants, the ministers, the chief ministers,

original: sgo ba dang / 'khor rnams su bcas pa de dag thams cad kyang dge slong de na bar thos nas rab tu ngu zhing mchi ma 'byin te /
analyzed: sgo ba dang / 'khor rnams su bcas pa de dag thams cad kyang dge slong de na bar thos nas rab tu ngu zhing mchi ma 'byin te /
translated: the doorkeepers, and the retinue, all of them, having heard that the bhikṣu was sick, wept and shed tears.

original: dge slong 'di 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur ta re zhes skad 'dzer to //
analyzed: dge slong 'di 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur ta re zhes skad 'dzer to //
translated: “This bhikṣu will die.”

original: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes stobs la lha mo sngen snag gi gnyen mtshams su gyur pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po ye shes stobs la lha mo sngen snag gi gnyen mtshams su gyur pa zhig yod de /
translated: “Young man, at that time King Jñānabala had a friend who was a goddess.

original: de rgyal po de'i phyi @193a *//
analyzed: de rgyal po de'i phyi @193a *//
translated: She followed the king

original: bzhin 'brang bas rmi lam du bstan pa /
analyzed: bzhin 'brang bas rmi lam du bstan pa /
translated: and appeared to him in a dream, saying,

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: ‘Great King,

analyzed: gal te dge slong 'di la mi'i sha dang khrag gsar pa ma rul bas 'brum bu me dbal nag po 'di la byugs te /
translated: if you anoint this bhikṣu with fresh human flesh and blood that is not rotten,

analyzed: mi'i sha gsar pa ma rul ba las ro sna tshogs su g-yos byas te byin na dge slong 'di nad 'di las 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and if you give him fresh human flesh that is not rotten and is seasoned with various flavors, this bhikṣu will recover from this illness.’

original: de nas rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs mtshan mo de 'das pa dang gnyid kyis log pa las sad de btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'ongs nas rmi lam gyi rnam pa de dag btsun mo'i 'khor rnams la bzlas te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ye shes kyi stobs mtshan mo de 'das pa dang gnyid kyis log pa las sad de btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'ongs nas rmi lam gyi rnam pa de dag btsun mo'i 'khor rnams la bzlas te /
translated: “Then, when the night had passed, King Jñānabala awoke from sleep and entered the harem, where he told the women about the dream.

original: nga'i rmi lam 'di lta bu zhig mthong ngo zhes bzlas nas go bar byas na /
analyzed: nga'i rmi lam 'di lta bu zhig mthong ngo zhes bzlas nas go bar byas na /
translated: “I have had such and such a dream.”

original: gzhon nu / de ltar bud med kyi khyim de dang / rgyal po'i pho brang de nas dge slong de la rtsi de sbyin par su'ang spro ba med do //
analyzed: gzhon nu / de ltar bud med kyi khyim de dang / rgyal po'i pho brang de nas dge slong de la rtsi de sbyin par su'ang spro ba med do //
translated: “Young man, in that way, no one in the women’s quarters or in the king’s palace was willing to give the medicine to the bhikṣu.

original: rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes ldan yang rmi lam de lta bu zhig rmis nas sad pa dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du song ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes ldan yang rmi lam de lta bu zhig rmis nas sad pa dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du song ste /
translated: “The king’s daughter, Jñānāvatī, also had a dream like that. When she awoke she went to the inner quarters and told her mother and her attendants about the dream.

original: rmi lam gyi rnam pa de dag ma dang / zhabs 'bring ba rnams la gtam byas kyang dge slong de la rtsi de sbyin par su'ang spro ba med do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam pa de dag ma dang / zhabs 'bring ba rnams la gtam byas kyang dge slong de la rtsi de sbyin par su'ang spro ba med do //
translated: “ ‘No one was willing to give the medicine to the bhikṣu.

original: de nas rgyal po'i sras mo ye shes ldan de dga' zhing mgu /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i sras mo ye shes ldan de dga' zhing mgu /
translated: “Then the king’s daughter, Jñānāvatī, was delighted,

original: yi rangs shing rab tu dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / yid bde ba skyes nas 'di lta bur brtson par byas te /
analyzed: yi rangs shing rab tu dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / yid bde ba skyes nas 'di lta bur brtson par byas te /
translated: and she was satisfied, happy, delighted, joyful, and blissful. She made this kind of effort:

original: 'di ltar bdag gis rtsi 'di dag bdag gi lus las bcad de ji skad bstan pa bzhin du khrag gsar ba dang sha gsar ba sbyin par @193b bya'o; ;rgyal po'i pho brang na bdag ni thams cad kyi nang na gzhon zhing chung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis rtsi 'di dag bdag gi lus las bcad de ji skad bstan pa bzhin du khrag gsar ba dang sha gsar ba sbyin par @193b bya'o; ;rgyal po'i pho brang na bdag ni thams cad kyi nang na gzhon zhing chung ste /
translated: “ ‘I will cut off this flesh from my body and give it to him as he has requested, fresh blood and fresh flesh. I am the youngest and least in the king’s palace.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
translated: My body, speech, and mind are not afflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ye shes btsal bar 'dod pas chos smra ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la bdag gi lus kyi sha dang khrag phul te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ye shes btsal bar 'dod pas chos smra ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la bdag gi lus kyi sha dang khrag phul te /
translated: I will offer my flesh and blood to the affliction-free Dharma teacher, who seeks the wisdom that is free from affliction.

original: dge slong 'di ci nas nad 'di las sos par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ci nas nad 'di las sos par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will do whatever it takes to heal this bhikṣu.’

original: de nas rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes ldan de rang gi gnas su song nas mtshon rnon po thogs te chos la zhugs pa'i yid kyis bdag gi brla las sha bcad nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes ldan de rang gi gnas su song nas mtshon rnon po thogs te chos la zhugs pa'i yid kyis bdag gi brla las sha bcad nas /
translated: “Then the king’s daughter Jñānāvatī returned to her home, took a sharp knife, and with a mind focused on the Dharma, cut flesh from her thigh.

original: ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa gyi nom par g-yos byas nas /
analyzed: ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa gyi nom par g-yos byas nas /
translated: She prepared a variety of flavors and condiments,

analyzed: khrag kyang thogs te 'phags pa de'i drung du song nas rgyal po ye shes stobs kyi mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: He went to the noble one and sat in front of King Jñānabala.

original: khrag gis 'brum bu me dbal nag po de byugs nas /
analyzed: khrag gis 'brum bu me dbal nag po de byugs nas /
translated: He smeared the black smallpox pustules with blood

analyzed: g-yos legs par byas pa'i zas de dge slong de zar bcug ste /
translated: and made the monk eat the well-prepared food.

original: 'grangs par byed cing legs par bstabs so //
analyzed: 'grangs par byed cing legs par bstabs so //
translated: He filled him up and served it well.

original: de nas dge slong de mi shes /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de mi shes /
translated: Then, the monk, not knowing,

original: ma rig / ma dogs pas zas de zos so //
analyzed: ma rig / ma dogs pas zas de zos so //
translated: not understanding, not suspecting, ate that food.

original: zas de zos mthag tu dge slong de'i na tsha thams cad med par gyur te nad de thams cad kyang sos so //
analyzed: zas de zos mthag tu dge slong de'i na tsha thams cad med par gyur te nad de thams cad kyang sos so //
translated: As soon as he had eaten that food, all the monk's illnesses disappeared and all his diseases were cured.

original: de yongs su gdung ba dang bral zhing bde ba dang ldan pas de lta de lta bur chos bstan te /
analyzed: de yongs su gdung ba dang bral zhing bde ba dang ldan pas de lta de lta bur chos bstan te /
translated: Free from distress, endowed with happiness, he taught the Dharma in such and such a way

analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor de dang / grong pa dang / yul mi dang / yul 'khor pa 'dus pa de dag las srog chags khri nyis stong bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: that among that retinue of queens, that assembly of townspeople, countrymen, and provincial people, twelve thousand beings gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas @194a *//
analyzed: de nas @194a *//
translated: Then,🔽🔽

analyzed: rgyal po ye shes stobs kyis bdag gi bu mo la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //

translated: Where did you get this human flesh?

translated: Daughter, by preparing this food,

translated: this dharmabhāṇaka has become so happy.

original: sna tshogs bro dang ldan pa'i g-yos byas pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs bro dang ldan pa'i g-yos byas pa //
translated: “ ‘You prepared a variety of flavors,

analyzed: bsad pa yin nam de ste shi ba rnyed; ;bu mo khyod kyis khrag 'di ga las rnyed //
translated: but did you kill him or did you find him dead? Daughter, where did you get this blood?

original: des ni sdig pa'i nad las 'di thar byas //
analyzed: des ni sdig pa'i nad las 'di thar byas //
translated: By it he was freed from his sinful illness.’

original: bu mo des ni pha yi tshig thos nas //
analyzed: bu mo des ni pha yi tshig thos nas //
translated: “When the daughter heard her father’s words,

original: bu mo ye shes ldan gyis 'di skad smras //
analyzed: bu mo ye shes ldan gyis 'di skad smras //
translated: the daughter Jñānāvatī said this:

analyzed: zhum sems med par tshig kyang rab smras te //
translated: ‘I will speak without any hesitation.

analyzed: bdag ni ci mchi yab khyod gsan du gsol // lha yis bstan pa'i rmi lam dag /
translated: Listen, Father, to what I have to say.🔽“ ‘Father, I had a dream

original: bdag gis mthong bar gyur to yab //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong bar gyur to yab //
translated: that was shown to me by a god.

original: sa yi bdag po bdag la gson //
analyzed: sa yi bdag po bdag la gson //
translated: Listen to me, Lord of the Earth.

original: yang dag don ni mkhyen par mdzod //
analyzed: yang dag don ni mkhyen par mdzod //
translated: “ ‘You must know the right meaning.

original: lha des bdag la 'di skad ston //🔽mi yi sha dang khrag rnams ni //
analyzed: lha des bdag la 'di skad ston // mi yi sha dang khrag rnams ni //
translated: The god taught me this:🔽“Whoever gives the flesh and blood of a human

original: dge slong 'di la sus byin na //
analyzed: dge slong 'di la sus byin na //
translated: To this bhikṣu

original: sdig pa'i nad las thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa'i nad las thar bar 'gyur //
translated: Will be freed from the illness of bad karma.

original: bdag ni mal nas langs nas su //
analyzed: bdag ni mal nas langs nas su //

translated: Then the Blessed One said to the youthful Candraprabha,

original: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mnyan par bya /🔽gzung bar bya /🔽kun chub par bya /
analyzed: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mnyan par bya / gzung bar bya / kun chub par bya /
translated: “Young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to attain quickly the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood should listen to this samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, learn it, understand it, keep it, recite it to others, promote it, proclaim it, chant it, meditate on it with unadulterated meditation, promulgate it, and make it widely known to others.
